Description: Mould-made scarab in glazed composition; back simply modelled with incised single lines, representing the features of clypeus, prothorax and elytra, with humeral callosities present and feathered legs at front; at side, legs quite well-modelled with undercut triangle; underside bearing hieroglyphic inscription, arranged horizontally, giving the name of Amun-Ra with a neb-basket sign to left; inscription probably stamped rather than incised, encircled by groove near edge; longitudinally pierced; glaze lost; creamy yellow core.
Curator's comments: The 'Scarab Factory' in Naukratis produced variants of the name of Amun-Ra on scarabs and scaraboids made out of glazed composition (Petrie 1886, pl. 37, 89-93; Gardner 1888, pl. 18, no. 25 and 36; on the various productions of the Scarab Factory, see Webb forthcoming). This scarab was attributed to a type which was distributed in the Mediterranean area, especially in Greece and Punic sites (Gorton 1996, 129-131, type XXXVI, subtype 16-22, see especially 21 for this piece). By the techniques used in its production, the size of the scarab, the shape of its back and the inscription on its underside (giving the name of Amun-Ra), it is closer to the scarabs belonging to Gorton's type XXVIII B: see for example BM 1886,0401.1660 and Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.865. Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Gorton, A. F. 1996, Egyptian and Egyptianizing scarabs: a typology of steatite, faience and paste scarabs from Punic and other Mediterranean sites, Oxford. Petrie, W. M. F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Webb, V. forthcoming, 'Faience finds from Naukratis and their implications for the chronology of the site', in R. Thomas (ed.) forthcoming, Naukratis in Context I: The Nile Delta as a Landscape of Connectivity. Proceedings of the First Naukratis Project Workshop held at The British Museum 16th – 17th December 2011.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 89)
